intro: Pseudolysimachion spicatum subsp. klokovii, commonly known as the Klokov's spiculate lythrum, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the Caucasus region. It belongs to the Lythraceae family and is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, pinkish-red flowers. The plant features slender, branched stems and lanceolate leaves with a slightly hairy surface. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland edges or stream banks. Its ornamental value makes it a sought-after plant in horticulture, though it is less commonly cultivated than other members of its genus.
